trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Mimecast Admin Console | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Mimecast Admin Console | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mimecast Admin Console with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mimecast Admin Console with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Mimecast Admin Console
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Mimecast Admin Console

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529833).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529833).

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Mimecast Admin Console.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Mimecast Admin Console.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Mimecast Admin Console single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Mimecast Admin Console single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Mimecast Admin Console will be able to single sign into the application at your Mimecast Admin Console company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Mimecast Admin Console will be able to single sign into the application at your Mimecast Admin Console company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Mimecast Admin Console
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Mimecast Admin Console

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Mimecast Admin Console
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Mimecast Admin Console

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Mimecast Admin Console.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Mimecast Admin Console.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Mimecast Admin Console, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Mimecast Admin Console, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Active Directory

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: Applications
trans-unit.target: Applications

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Add application
trans-unit.target: Add application

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Add an application from gallerry
trans-unit.target: Add an application from gallerry

trans-unit.source: In the **search box**, type **Mimecast Admin Console**.
trans-unit.target: In the **search box**, type **Mimecast Admin Console**.

trans-unit.source: Application Gallery
trans-unit.target: Application Gallery

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select **Mimecast Admin Console**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select **Mimecast Admin Console**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: Mimecast Admin Console
trans-unit.target: Mimecast Admin Console

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Mimecast Admin Console with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Mimecast Admin Console with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o).
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o).

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the **Mimecast Admin Console** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the **Mimecast Admin Console** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: On the **How would you like users to sign on to Mimecast Admin Console** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **How would you like users to sign on to Mimecast Admin Console** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure App URL** page, in the **Mimecast Admin Console Sign On URL** textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Mimecast Admin Console application (e.g.: “https://webmail-uk.mimecast.com” or “https://webmail-us.mimecast.com”), and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure App URL** page, in the **Mimecast Admin Console Sign On URL** textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Mimecast Admin Console application (e.g.: “https://webmail-uk.mimecast.com” or “https://webmail-us.mimecast.com”), and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The sign on URL is region specific.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The sign on URL is region specific.

trans-unit.source: Configure App URL
trans-unit.target: Configure App URL

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Admin Console** page, to download your certificate, click **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Admin Console** page, to download your certificate, click **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Mimecast Admin Console as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Mimecast Admin Console as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Services \> Application**.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Services \> Application**.

trans-unit.source: Services
trans-unit.target: Services

trans-unit.source: Click **Authentication Profiles**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Authentication Profiles**.

trans-unit.source: Authentication Profiles
trans-unit.target: Authentication Profiles

trans-unit.source: Click **New Authentication Profile**.
trans-unit.target: Click **New Authentication Profile**.

trans-unit.source: New Authentication Profiles
trans-unit.target: New Authentication Profiles

trans-unit.source: In the **Authentication Profile** section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the **Authentication Profile** section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Authentication Profile
trans-unit.target: Authentication Profile

trans-unit.source: In the **Description** textbox, type a name for your configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the **Description** textbox, type a name for your configuration.

trans-unit.source: Select **Enforce SAML Authentication for Mimecast Admin Console**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Enforce SAML Authentication for Mimecast Admin Console**.

trans-unit.source: As **Provider**, select **Azure Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: As **Provider**, select **Azure Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Admin Console** dialog page, copy the **Issuer URL** value, and then paste it into the **Issuer URL** textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Admin Console** dialog page, copy the **Issuer URL** value, and then paste it into the **Issuer URL** textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Admin Console** dialog page, copy the **Remote Login URL** value, and then paste it into the **Login URL** textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Admin Console** dialog page, copy the **Remote Login URL** value, and then paste it into the **Login URL** textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Admin Console** dialog page, copy the **Remote Login URL** value, and then paste it into the **Logout URL** textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at Mimecast Admin Console** dialog page, copy the **Remote Login URL** value, and then paste it into the **Logout URL** textbox.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]The Login URL value and the Logout URL value are for the Mimecast Admin Console the same.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]The Login URL value and the Logout URL value are for the Mimecast Admin Console the same.

trans-unit.source: Create a **base-64 encoded** file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a **base-64 encoded** file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP]For more details, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP]For more details, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o).

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, remove the first line (“*--*“) and the last line (“*--*“), copy the remaining content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the **Identity Provider Certificate (Metadata)** textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, remove the first line (“*--*“) and the last line (“*--*“), copy the remaining content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the **Identity Provider Certificate (Metadata)** textbox.

trans-unit.source: Select **Allow Single Sign On**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Allow Single Sign On**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete** to close the **Configure Single Sign On** dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete** to close the **Configure Single Sign On** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Mimecast Admin Console, they must be provisioned into Mimecast Admin Console.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Mimecast Admin Console, they must be provisioned into Mimecast Admin Console.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Mimecast Admin Console, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Mimecast Admin Console, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: You need to register a domain before you can create users.
trans-unit.target: You need to register a domain before you can create users.

trans-unit.source: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Sign on to your **Mimecast Admin Console** as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sign on to your **Mimecast Admin Console** as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Directories \> Internal**.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Directories \> Internal**.

trans-unit.source: Directories
trans-unit.target: Directories

trans-unit.source: Click **Register New Domain**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Register New Domain**.

trans-unit.source: Register New Domain
trans-unit.target: Register New Domain

trans-unit.source: After your new domain has been created, click **New Address**.
trans-unit.target: After your new domain has been created, click **New Address**.

trans-unit.source: New Address
trans-unit.target: New Address

trans-unit.source: In the new address dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the new address dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Save
trans-unit.target: Save

trans-unit.source: Type the **Email Address**, **Global Name**, **Password** and **Confirm Password** attributes of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the **Email Address**, **Global Name**, **Password** and **Confirm Password** attributes of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]You can use any other Mimecast Admin Console user account creation tools or APIs provided by Mimecast Admin Console to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]You can use any other Mimecast Admin Console user account creation tools or APIs provided by Mimecast Admin Console to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Mimecast Admin Console, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Mimecast Admin Console, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the **Mimecast Admin Console **application integration page, click **Assign users**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Mimecast Admin Console **application integration page, click **Assign users**.

trans-unit.source: Assign Users
trans-unit.target: Assign Users

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
